title: Simple Pasta Aglio e Olio
description: A classic Roman pasta that proves the best dishes often have the fewest ingredients.
ingredients:
- 200g spaghetti
- 4 cloves garlic, thinly sliced
- 1/3 cup good olive oil
- 1/2 tsp red pepper flakes
- Fresh parsley, chopped
- Parmesan (optional)
- Salt to taste
instructions:
1. Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Cook pasta until just al dente, reserving 1 cup pasta water before draining.

2. While pasta cooks, heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-low heat. Add sliced garlic and cook slowly until golden (not brown), about 3-4 minutes.

3. Add red pepper flakes, cook 30 seconds.

4. Add drained pasta and 1/4 cup pasta water. Toss vigorously to emulsify.

5. Add parsley, adjust salt, and serve immediately with parmesan if desired.
notes: The key is cooking the garlic low and slow—golden, never brown. The pasta water helps create a silky sauce.

title: Miso Glazed Salmon
description: Sweet, savory, and incredibly simple. The miso creates a beautiful caramelized crust.
ingredients:
- 2 salmon fillets
- 2 tbsp white miso paste
- 1 tbsp mirin
- 1 tbsp sake or rice wine
- 1 tsp sugar
- Sesame seeds for garnish
- Green onions, sliced
instructions:
1. Mix miso, mirin, sake, and sugar until smooth.

2. Coat salmon fillets with the miso mixture. Let marinate 30 minutes (or overnight in fridge).

3. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).

4. Place salmon on a lined baking sheet. Bake 10-12 minutes until glaze caramelizes and fish flakes easily.

5. Garnish with sesame seeds and green onions.
notes: Watch carefully under the broiler at the end if you want extra caramelization—the sugars can burn quickly.
